duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead a team of DevOps engineers to automate solutions, secure data, and own all aspects of infrastructure for high availability, scalability, and reliability.
Coach the team on principles of automation, visibility improvements, self-healing, high availability, scalability, and root cause analysis.
Partner with development engineering to improve reliability, implement actionable monitoring framework, and establish on-call/incident response process.
Provide thought and subject matter leadership in DevOps, including managing multi-cloud infrastructure and advising development managers in structuring and sizing plans.
Automate release deployments across all stacks and optimize for scalability, efficiency, and security.
Develop effective tooling to accelerate deploy and release management and introduce new technologies into existing computing environments.
Design and implement highly available infrastructures, monitoring and logging services, and operational standards in collaboration with application engineering.
Continually manage cloud assets to ensure right-sized and minimize sprawl, and ensure compliance with required SOC1, SOC2 standards.
Design and implement a disaster recovery/remote service strategy, perform routine audits of systems and software, and remain current on technology infrastructure changes in the industry.
Integrate with developers and configuration management team to implement best practices and cross-collaborate in bug management and feature release.
Perform other related duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in computer science or related discipline highly preferred.
